DataElement.preferredName: Cardiac Condition Uncontrolled Hypertension Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable indicator that describes if patient has uncontrolled hypertension.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the heart._A state of being, such as a state of health._Not controlled, regulated, or constrained._Blood pressure that is abnormally high.

A state of being, such as a state of health.

Property.preferredDefinition: Not controlled, regulated, or constrained.:Blood pressure that is abnormally high.

Concepts.definition: Blood pressure that is abnormally high.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have evidence of ongoing inadequately controlled hypertension (defined as a systolic BP greater than 140 mmHg or a diastolic BP greater than 90 mmHg)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Uncontrolled hypertension (Sy
ReferenceDocuments.description: Uncontrolled hypertension (Systolic blood pressure [BP] greater than 150 mmHg and diastolic BP greater than 90 mmHg for 24 hours) despite optimal medical management.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have inadequately controlled hypertension (systolic blood pressure greater than 150 mmHg or diastolic pressure greater than 90 mmHg on anti-hypertensive medications)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have concurrent uncontrolled hypertension defined as sustained BP greater than 140 mm Hg systolic, or greater than 90 mm Hg diastolic despite optimal antihypertensive treatment within 7 days of the first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have treatment-refractory hypertension defined as a blood pressure of systolic greater than 140 mmHg and/or diastolic greater than 90 mmHg which cannot be controlled by anti-hypertensive therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have poorly-controlled hypertension as defined BP greater than 150/100 mmHg, or SBP greater than 180 mmHg when DBP less than 90 mmHg, on at least 2 repeated determinations on separate days within 3 months prior to study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have poorly-controlled hypertension as defined BP greater than 150/100 mmHg, or SBP greater than 180 mmHg when DBP less than 90 mmHg, on at least 2 repeated determinations on separate days within 3 months prior to study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled hypertension (i.e. systolic blood pressure greater than 180 mmHg, diastolic blood pressure greater than 95 mmHg)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled high blood pressure (i.e., systolic blood pressure greater than 180 mm Hg, diastolic blood pressure greater than 95 mm Hg)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have poorly controlled hypertension (defined as systolic blood pressure [SBP] of greater than or equal to 140mmHg or diastolic blood pressure [DBP] of greater than or equal to 90mmHg)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled hypertension defined as blood pressure [BP] of greater than or equal to 150/95 for adults despite medical support/management and if 18 years of age and younger should have a blood pressure less than or equal to 95th percentile for age, height and gender?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled hypertension (blood pressure [BP] of greater than or equal to 150/95 despite medical support/management)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled or poorly controlled hypertension despite standard medical management as defined in this protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have uncontrolled systemic hypertension as defined in the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled hypertension as indicated by a resting systolic blood pressure greater than 170 mmHg or diastolic blood pressure greater than 105 mmHg at the screening visit?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled arterial hypertension?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled hypertension (blood pressure [BP] of greater than or equal to 150/95 mmHg despite medical therapy)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled high blood pressure that cannot be controlled by standard therapies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled hypertension (grade 2 or above) requiring clinical intervention?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled hypertension defined as sustained blood pressure (BP) greater than 140 mm Hg systolic or greater than 90 mm Hg diastolic despite optimal antihypertensive treatment within seven days prior to the first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: In the opinion of the investigator, does patient have uncontrolled arterial hypertension despite optimal medical management?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled hypertension (greater than or equal 150/90)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled hypertension (systolic blood pressure greater than 180 mmHg, diastolic blood pressure greater than 95 mmHg)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled hypertension (persistent systolic blood pressure greater than or equal to 160 mmHg or diastolic blood pressure greater than or equal to 100 mmHg)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled hypertension (defined as blood pressure greater than or equal to 150/90 mm/Hg) despite optimal medical management (per investigator's opinion)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have poorly controlled hypertension with at least 2 occasions of elevated blood pressure within a week before treatment initiation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled hypertension as indicated by a systolic blood pressure greater than or equal to 160 mmHg or diastolic blood pressure greater than or equal to 100 mmHg at screening?

DataElement.changeDescription: 11-21-18 TT changed reg status to Application.  6/24/14 created for Theradex eligibility CRF. jc
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 7/20/2022: fixed the box symbol in AQT.wz
